template.name: Template - APC UPS
template.description:
uses apcaccess and apcupsd command to monitor local APC UPS.
please ensure that apcupsd is installed and configured correctly, and apcaccess reports reliable information.

item.name: Battery Charge - PCT%
item.description: How much battery remains, as a percent

item.name: Battery Datestamp
item.description:
Date Battery was installed to the UPS.
This has to be updated manually via apctest. It also requires stopping apcupsd to do this. This is NOT done automatically. This date can be set to anything, and only works if you make it work.
It is not expected to change.
included because it might be useful in troubleshooting failures.(i.e. old battery)

item.name: UPS Info
item.description: Static information on the UPS. This information is not supposed to change, hence short storage period.

item.name: UPS Online
item.description: Boolean check if UPS is online 1 - yes 0 - no

item.name: UPS Last Transfer Message
item.description:
LASTXFER status from apcaccess. This is a text message of the reason the last switch from line power to battery power, i.e. failure.
Collected for troubleshooting drilldown.

item.name: UPS Load - PCT%
item.description: Load of UPS, as a percentage of total capacity

item.name: Battery Maximum Runtime
item.description: Maximum Runtime for UPS on battery power.

item.name: Charge inverted
item.description: Inverse of battery percentage, for use with graphing

item.name: Battery Time Left
item.description: Time left before battery runs out, in minuetes

item.name: Battery Time Ran
item.description: Amount of time already used on battery, inverse of time remaining

item.name: Line Voltage
item.description: Input voltage, as measured by the UPS

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - UPS - Battery Critical!
trigger.description:
Battery Critical: Less then 5% of Battery is left.
Server risks going offline.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - UPS - Battery Low
trigger.description: Battery Low Warning: Battery is less then 10%

trigger.expression: {Template - APC UPS:ups.status.str(REPLACEBATT)}=1 or {Template - APC UPS:ups.status.str(NOBATT)}=1 or {Template - APC UPS:ups.status.str(COMMLOST)}=1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - UPS - Check hardware
trigger.description:
One of the following states is active: 1. No Battery 2. Communication Lost - Cable unplugged 3. Replace battery.
Check hardware, and output of apcacess.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - UPS - Maintenance
trigger.description: Check if the UPS is in maintenance mode

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - UPS - On Battery
trigger.description: UPS is on battery, recovers when UPS is online

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - UPS - Software Failure
trigger.description: There is a failure with apcupsd. 1. Check apcupsd is running 2. Check that apcacess command can function 3. check the zabbix_apcups.sh script to ensure it can run correctly as the zabbix user, and said user can run the apcaccess. absolute PATHs are at top of file. make sure these are correct.
